definitions.definition: a small part or amount of something

examples.text: Only a small fraction of a bank's total deposits will be withdrawn at any one time.
She hesitated for the merest fraction of a second.
He raised his voice a fraction.
A mere fraction of available wind energy is currently utilized.
The average income is high, though many people earn just a fraction of that average.
Why not grow your own fruit at a fraction of the price?

definitions.definition: a division of a number, for example ⅝

examples.text: How do you express 25% as a fraction?

definitions.definition: a quantity of liquid that has been collected as a result of a process that separates the parts of a liquid mixture

examples.text: The third fraction contains alcohols with boiling points of 120–130℃.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: via Old French from ecclesiastical Latin fractio(n-) ‘breaking (bread)’, from Latin frangere ‘to break’.
